alert.note: Alert for Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 8:21AM CST until January 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Lavaca. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Several road closures have been reported in and around Shiner and Hallettsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area through tonight. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yoakum, Hallettsville, Shiner, Sublime, Worthing, Mont, Wied, Breslau, Koerth, Witting, Vsetin, Sweet Home, Mount Olive and Vienna. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
